I believe a reasonably educated person with a logical mind can read and interpret the Sri Lanka constitution for what it is. Now, sections I quote here are direct extract from it. 
Item 3 says: ‚ÄúIn the Republic of Sri Lanka sovereignty is in the people and is inalienable. Sovereignty includes the powers of government, fundamental rights and the franchise.‚Äù

Item 4 (a)¬† says: ‚Äúthe legislative power of the people shall be exercised by Parliament, Parliament, consisting of elected representatives of the People and by the People at a Referendum‚Äù

Still stuck to your wrong opinion?
